mods.abstract: RAN AWAY FROM the undersigned, in Opelousas, about the 1st of February last, a mulatto woman, named FANNY, aged about 22 years, rather low stature, and stout built, round face, has a scar on one of her legs, from a bile, speaks english only. A griffe girl, named EULALIE, aged about 24 years, slim face, tall stature, speaking French and a little English, one of her fingers has been damaged by a fellon, she is a creole girl. A liberal reward will be [illegible] or lodge them in Jail [illegible] them back. B. NEY. Opelousas, March. 7th 1857. The Register of Franklin will please copy the above till forbid, in French and English.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
